Airlines operating within europe are obliged to offset part of their CO2 emissions. If they fail to comply they will be faced with a fine!
EU ETS (european union emissions trading scheme) introduce carbon tax law on all airlines arriving and departing from european airports!
One carbon credit is the equivalent to a saving of one tonne of carbon dioxide (CO2).
Carbon credits earned by renewable energy projects can be sold to other businesses and individuals to "offset" the emissions they generate.
Carbon credits are certificates that represent a reduction of greenhouse gases in the atmoshphere. Projects that prevent GHG earn credits.
VERs are subject to a high standard and emissions reductions must be: real, measurable, permanent, additional and independently verified.
Voluntary Carbon credits, Verified Emission Reductions (VER's) are generated by renewable energy projects verified by a third party.
Carbon Compliances UK based carbon emissions consultancy specialises in providing the opportunity to purchase VCS approved carbon credits.
